column6: Prevention and mitigation of occupational health and safety impacts directly linked by business relationships
column13: Our businesses also run safety campaigns to empower customers with key safety actions. During the European summer break, APRR organised activities at rest areas along the A6 to encourage customers to stop regularly and prevent driver fatigue. Activities ranged from carnival rides and face painting to archery and CPR training.
column20: Safety Campaigns, Customer Empowerment, Preventive Action

column6: Workers covered by an occupational health and safety management system
Work-related injuries
column7: At APRR, we did not meet our large business safety target with a lost-time injury frequency rate of 3.4. Pleasingly, we met our target of one or fewer lost-time injuries at our small businesses, with one lost-time injury at Chicago Skyway and no lost-time injuries recorded at Warnow Tunnel, Dulles Greenway, or the Corporate level.

column6: Work-related injuries
column7: Warnow Tunnel took positive steps to improve safety and the customer experience, achieving zero lost-time injuries (LTIs) during the calendar year.

column7: We support a strong safety culture, and in 2023, Chicago Skyway conducted over 772 hours of safety training to keep our employees and customers safe.

Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column7: We hosted the 3rd Run the Greenway event, raising over US$268,000 for local charities.

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column7: Dulles Greenway continued to foster strong community links through engagement with local stakeholders during the year. The third Run the Greenway event was held in May 2023 in Northern Virginia, with around 2,000 people participating, a significant increase versus 2022. Overall, the event was highly successful, with around US$268,000 raised for local non-profit organisations, bringing the total raised over the three years to approximately US$644,000 Ã¢ÂÂ a fantastic achievement.

Negative social impacts in the supply chain and actions taken
column7: Our third Modern Slavery Statement (2022) was published in June 2023 and reflected our work to prevent modern slavery in our business and supply chain. For the first time, our statement received an A in the Monash University Modern Slavery Statement Disclosure Quality Rating Report.\t

column6: Political contributions
column7: Atlas Arteria makes donations and contributes funds to the community and not-for-profit organisations as part of its community investment and sustainability approach. It does not make political donations. However, in line with other major publicly listed companies, Atlas Arteria does pay fees to attend events organised by political parties, which allow for discussion on major policy issues with key opinion leaders and policymakers.

column6: Assessment of the health and safety impacts of product and service categories
column7: The transition to 100% LED lighting outside the tunnel was completed in August 2023. The brighter lighting allows drivers to safely adapt to lighting conditions when entering the tunnel, which results in less braking and reduced accident risks.

column6: Incidents of non-compliance concerning the health and safety impacts of products and services
column7: We collect only the Personal Information we need to perform our functions and activities and only use or disclose information for the purpose for which it was collected, with the individual's consent or as permitted by law or regulation. Suppose personal information or data is collected during business. In that case, Atlas Arteria Staff must comply with and follow the Personal Information handling practices set out in Atlas Arteria's internal Privacy Policy.
